question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate, professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable and displayable. Build an intelligent email template generator that supports variable interpolation (such as {name}), conditional logic blocks, and multi-topic A/B testing. Requirements include providing a visual editing interface, sending record tracking, and open rate statistics with chart displays.

checklist.title: Is the email template generator core functionality implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code correctly implements variable interpolation (e.g., {name}, {company}), conditional logic blocks (if-else statements for content customization), and template storage/retrieval. Score 0 if the core functionality is missing, 5 if only basic interpolation is implemented, and 10 if all required template features (interpolation, conditionals, and multi-topic A/B testing logic) are fully functional.

checklist.title: Is the visual editing interface well-designed and functional?
checklist.description: Check if the interface provides intuitive WYSIWYG editing capabilities, with clear separation between editing mode and preview mode. Verify that users can easily insert variables, add conditional blocks, and set up A/B testing variants. Deduct 5 points if drag-and-drop functionality is missing, 3 points if real-time preview isn't available, and 2 points if the UI doesn't provide clear visual indicators for dynamic elements (variables, conditionals). The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the A/B testing mechanism properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code includes a complete A/B testing system that can randomly select content variants for different recipients, track which variant was sent to whom, and analyze performance differences. Check for proper audience segmentation capabilities and statistical significance calculation. Deduct 5 points if variant distribution isn't randomized properly, and 5 points if there's no mechanism to declare a winning variant. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are the email tracking and analytics features functioning?
checklist.description: Assess whether the system can track email opens, link clicks, and display this data in charts/graphs with proper visualization. Verify that tracking pixels/codes are correctly implemented, and data collection respects privacy regulations. Check if the analytics dashboard provides meaningful metrics (open rates, click rates, conversion rates). Deduct 5 points if tracking implementation has security flaws, and 5 points if visualization lacks filtering or comparison capabilities. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common edge cases (such as missing variables, malformed templates, large data sets, concurrent users) and provides friendly error handling with appropriate feedback. Code with strong robustness should validate all inputs, handle template parsing exceptions gracefully, and implement appropriate timeouts. Give 10 points for comprehensive error handling, 5 points for partial implementation, and 0 points if no exception handling exists.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. AI-assisted content suggestions 2. Sentiment analysis of email content 3. Automated send-time optimization based on recipient behavior 4. Responsive preview across multiple device types). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple template engines coexisting) 2. Function modules unrelated to email generation (e.g., a built-in social media manager) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., unnecessary animations in the dashboard). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating template engine/UI/analytics layers), unit test coverage, and build process automation. Check for proper dependency management and secure handling of email content (sanitization, encoding). Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size â‰¥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Check if the template editor provides clear visual hierarchy and if the analytics dashboard presents data clearly without visual clutter. Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Template editor updates preview within 500ms 2) Transition animations controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual feedback when saving templates or running A/B tests. Assess if the interface provides appropriate loading states when fetching analytics data or sending test emails. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual stutter during template editing, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
